subject: Actually prune stale branches in src-repos
commit_message:
Actually prune stale branches in src-repos

The source-repositories element attempted to prune stale branches from
the local cache repos but failed because it was fetching specific refs
instead of updating remote tracking branches. Address this by performing
an explicit `git remote update --prune` prior to other git operations,
then comparing the list of local branches to the list of remote
branches. Any branch that is present locally but not on any remote will
be deleted.

This has the side effect of fetching refs early, short circuiting much
of the "fetch the ref we need" code in this element. That code is left
in place as there may be corner cases where a git remote update will not
fetch the ref that we want requiring us to be more explicit.

subject: Reduce memory consumption of gate tests
commit_message:
Reduce memory consumption of gate tests

Recently, the gate jobs took too long to complete (between 2 to 8
hours). The reason is jenkins slave agent die during the test, which
cause the CI to re-start the whole test in a new VM.

The failure mainly occurred at magnum-api pipeline, but also occurred
at other pipelines. In term of distribution of test nodes, this
failure mainly occurred at OVH nodes, in which there is no dedicated
swap device. As a result, at OVH nodes, local disk is used for swap
when memory is over-consuming. It looks this leads to resource
starvation, which cause the failure.

This patch attempted to reduce the memory consumption of the gate
tests. In the api test, the number of worker nodes was reduced from
2 to 1. In all tests (api/k8s/swarm/mesos), the memory of worker node
was reduced from 1G to 512M.

Closes-Bug: #1542386

subject: Index child plugins as part of parent
commit_message:
Index child plugins as part of parent

Runs indexing for child plugins as part of the parent;
errors if a child plugin is specified in the 'type' list to index sync.

When a parent is indexed, it will create mappings for any detected
child plugins, and index their data. Child plugins must implement
a property 'parent_plugin_type' whose value is the resource type of
the parent; the _parent mapping field is applied automatically.

This should assist with a restriction in elasticsearch 2.x whereby
parent mappings cannot exist prior to child mappings being created.
Ordering is such that the parent will come last. It is also necessary
in Elasticsearch 2.x to assign a _routing value when indexing child
documents; this is left to a separate patch.

subject: Use round robin failover strategy for Kombu driver
commit_message:
Use round robin failover strategy for Kombu driver

Shuffle strategy we use right now leads to increased reconnection time
and provides no benefit. Sometimes it might lead to RPC operations
timeout because the strategy provides no guarantee on how long the
reconnection process will take. See the referenced bug for details.

On the other side, round-robin strategy provides least achievable
reconnection time. It also provides guarantee that if K of N RabbitMQ
hosts are alive, it will take at most N - K + 1 attempts to
successfully reconnect to RabbitMQ cluster.

With shuffle strategy during failover clients connect to random hosts
and so the load is distributed evenly between alive RabbitMQs.
But since we shuffle list of hosts before providing it to Kombu, load
will be distributed evenly with round-robin strategy as well.

DocImpact
A new configuration option kombu_failover_strategy for Kombu driver is
added. It determines how the next RabbitMQ node is chosen in case the
one we are currently connected to becomes unavailable. It takes effect
only if more than one RabbitMQ node is provided in config. Available
options are:

 * round-robin: each RabbitMQ host in the list is tried in cycle until
   oslo.messaging successfully connects. Since oslo.messaging
   shuffles list of RabbitMQ hosts, the order of hosts in the cycle
   will be random and will not depend on order provided in config.

 * shuffle: oslo.messaging selects a random host from the list and
   tries to connect to it. If connection fails, oslo.messaging repeats
   attempt to connect to another random host. Oslo.messaging stops
   once it successfully connects to a host. Note that in each
   iteration a host to connect is selected independently of previous
   iterations, i.e. it might happen that oslo.messaging will try to
   connect to the same host several times in a row.

The option's default value is round-robin. Before the option was
introduced, the default strategy was shuffle. For the reasoning,
see the main body of the commit message and the referenced bug.

Closes-Bug: #1519851
Change-Id: I9a510c86bd5a6ce8b707734385af1a83de82804e
(cherry picked from commit 6ae46796a61fc97467450b5bdd51dc6a0c86f9f4)

subject: Enable in-process func tests to optionally use fast-post
commit_message:
Enable in-process func tests to optionally use fast-post

Running functional tests in the in-process mode uses
the default value for proxy-server object_post_as_copy,
which is True. This patch adds support for an environment
variable to change this value to False so that the fast-post
mode is tested when running in-process functional tests.

The patch also adds a new tox environment func-in-process-fast-post
which forces in-process functional testing with
object_post_as_copy=False.

The motivation for this change, apart from enabling configurable
local testing, is to put support in place for an upstream CI job
that will actually functionally test the fast-post mode, which is
otherwise only covered by unit tests.

There are currently two gate jobs that run the functional tests:

- gate-swift-dsvm-functional runs the tests *twice* against a
  devstack swift service, once using tempauth and once using
  keystoneauth. The devstack swift service uses the default
  object_post_as_copy=True.

- gate-swift-tox-func runs the func tests in in-process mode
  which also uses tempauth and object_post_as_copy=True. This
  duplicates one of the config scenarios above.

With this change either the gate-swift-tox-func job or a new job
could run the functional tests using object_post_as_copy=False.

Change-Id: Ia37f6df1dc38e44ef7404fbf0a52f6fc22fae0c2

commit_message:
Avoid lazy-loads in metadata requests

The metadata server currently doesn't pre-query for metadata and system_metadata,
which ends up generating *two* lazy-loads on many requests. Since especially

subject: Pass a host's volumes to the driver upon fail-over
commit_message:
Pass a host's volumes to the driver upon fail-over

Where grouping all of a Cinder backend's replicated volumes on a storage
array is not possible, vendors will need a list of volumes from the
manager at fail-over time in order to identify which volumes to fail-over.
This list should include all volumes that belong to the Cinder backend we
are failing-over.

With these volumes, a driver will then be able to determine which ones are
replicated (whether that is by volume type or all the volumes on the
backend) and fail-over each replicated volume individually.

This prevents drivers from accessing the Cinder database directly to
retrieve this list, as well as provides a solution for those who cannot
query their storage array to find all replicated volumes that belong to
a specific Cinder host on a specific OpenStack deployment.

subject: WIP Fix enforcement of default child quota values
commit_message:
WIP Fix enforcement of default child quota values

Moves nested quotas closer to a usable state by:
  * Disabling -1 limits in child projects until a fix for those land
  * Pushing the logic of checking for parent down into the quota driver
  * Not silencing failure to get_project from Keystone

This patch also has some consequences that should not be overlooked,
for instance if a deployment is using Keystone v3 "get_project" must
be able to performed for the current project before *any* quota related
operations can be performed (including create volume).  This is required
for keeping quotas in a good state, and it will not affect anyone on
with only Keystone v2 deployments.

The last point to note is this patch will not fix any existing
deployments which have "allocated" quota in DB in an incorrect state
from using the current nested quota code with limits=-1.

Change-Id: I5cf03494d0f1eb22dd6b998ee04a229da6c4da52

subject: Use custom repos for Ubuntu bootstrap image
commit_message:
Use custom repos for Ubuntu bootstrap image

The issue is that fuel-createmirror creates
partial mirror which does not follow
ubuntu repository structure practice.
It puts all necessary packages under main
section. It does create only one suite
(not suite-security, suite-updates).
This patch makes it possible to use such custom
mirrors giving to a user possibility to
define not only mirror root url
but also the list of suites: e.g. 'trusty trusty-updates'
as well as the list of sections: e.g. 'main restricted'.

Closes-Bug: #1486551

subject: WIP Enforce child quota default values
commit_message:
WIP Enforce child quota default values

POC to show how default child quotas can be fixed
by changing Keystone policy.json to allow admin_or_member to
retrieve projects, and then grabbing the project in the create_volume
path as well. A complete fix will involve:
* modifying policy.json in Keystone repo
* caching the project heirarchies on the Cinder side
* refactoring the quota mgmt commands so that get_project isn't called twice
* moving project helpers out of cinder/api/conrtib/quotas.py

For this POC to work, add the following rule to Keystone's policy.json:
    "admin_or_member":  "is_admin:True or project_id:%(project_id)s",
and modify the get_project line to be the following:
    "identity:get_project": "rule:admin_or_member",

Change-Id: I4feb1abe82b72744231e81b4e74a8f7b6ec02a86
